This is kind of a general crawl question, not specific to heritrix,
but I figured this was as good a place as any to ask it.  Basically,
when you're running a crawl, does a person generally monitor it, to
watch for it getting stuck on a site (calendars, etc) and make
adjustments, or do you have some kind of app that monitors it and
notifies someone?

I was just running a single site crawl to try some things with
settings and ended up having to add some filtering for it because it
had a forum message board and a calendar that was going to go on and
on.  This kind of thing would be hard to anticipate in advance (I
think) because sites are going to name pages different, implement
things different (php, html, etc.).

Rob
